Duplicated Value Smell.Description: This smell occurs when data values are syntactically equal across several data instances. Example: 12, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 3, 6, 13

Parameters.mostly: The mostly parameter defines that data is valid, if it is above a specific percentage value.

Extreme Value Smell.Description: This smell occurs when data instances have extreme data values relating to other data instances. Example: 1, 5, 10, 12, 6, 7, 2300, 13, 17

Parameters.threshold: The threshold to use regarding the z-score. This parameter can be configured by users but is set to 3 by default. It is assumed that this parameter is a positive number.
Parameters.mostly: The mostly parameter defines that data is valid, if it is above a specific percentage value.

Suspect Sign Smell.Description: This smell occurs when data instances have a different sign (+/-) than the rest of the instances. Example: 2, 7, 22, 13, 95, -5, 65, 20

Parameters.percentile_threshold: This parameter must be in the interval [0,1]. It controls which quantiles are computed. The computed quantiles are used to determine whether the majority of the column values are positive or negative.
Parameters.mostly: The mostly parameter defines that data is valid, if it is above a specific percentage value.

Integer As String Smell.Description: This smell occurs when an integer is encoded as a string. Example: "3"

Parameters.mostly: The mostly parameter defines that data is valid, if it is above a specific percentage value.

Floating Point Number As String Smell.Description: This smell occurs when a floating-point number is encoded as a string. Example: "3.5"

Parameters.mostly: The mostly parameter defines that data is valid, if it is above a specific percentage value.

Integer As Floating Point Number Smell.Description: This smell occurs when an integer is encoded as a floating-point number. Example: 3.0

Parameters.epsilon: The threshold for the absolute difference of a floating point number. to the nearest integer. This parameter must be a floating point value greater than zero.
Parameters.mostly: The mostly parameter defines that data is valid, if it is above a specific percentage value.

Casing Smell.Description: This smell occurs when data values represent an unusual use of upper and lower case (Mixed Case, Upper Only, Lower Only). Example: GoOD MorNiNg, GOOD MORNING, good morning

Parameters.same_case_wordcount_threshold: This parameter controls how many words must be contained in a string for a casing smell, where all words are of the same case, to exist. For instance, strings like ”all lowercase” or ”ALL UPPERCASE” with `same_case_wordcount_threshold = 2` would trigger this case while ”string” would not.
Parameters.mostly: The mostly parameter defines that data is valid, if it is above a specific percentage value.

Missing Value Smell.Description: This smell arises when data instances have no data values. Example: 12, 2, 3, , , 4, 55

Parameters.mostly: The mostly parameter defines that data is valid, if it is above a specific percentage value.

Long Data Value Smell.Description: This smell arises when data values are too long to understand. Example: Pneumonoultramicroscopicsilicovolcanoconiosis, 12Am12-12-20highpressalarmset0

Parameters.mostly: The mostly parameter defines that data is valid, if it is above a specific percentage value.
Parameters.length_threshold: The minimum number of characters a word must consist of to be considered "long". This parameter must be an integer greater than zero.
